info.name: BI Publisher
info.description:
# BI Publisher
Note: Reports will need to be set up manually per instance!

## Functional Guide link
[Guide](https://docs.google.com/document/d/13hFdGuP02BtyOMRHsvakl-Fy3ifWSlkDbYh9_HWwjG4/edit?usp=sharing "Guide Link")

body.raw:
<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:pub="http://xmlns.oracle.com/oxp/service/PublicReportService" xmlns:soapenv="http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope">
  <soapenv:Body>
    <pub:runReport>
      <pub:reportRequest>
        <pub:reportAbsolutePath>/Custom/More4apps/SQLReport/SQLReport.xdo</pub:reportAbsolutePath>
        <pub:sizeOfDataChunkDownload>-1</pub:sizeOfDataChunkDownload>
        <pub:attributeLocale>en-US</pub:attributeLocale>
        <pub:attributeTemplate>Default</pub:attributeTemplate>
        <pub:attributeFormat>xml</pub:attributeFormat>
        <pub:byPassCache>true</pub:byPassCache>
        <pub:flattenXML>false</pub:flattenXML>
        <pub:parameterNameValues>
          <pub:item>
            <pub:name>PLSQL</pub:name>
            <pub:values>
              <pub:item><![CDATA[ MO_GLOBAL.Init('AP_MANAGE_PAYABLES_INVOICE_DATA');  ]]></pub:item>
            </pub:values>
          </pub:item>
          <pub:item>
            <pub:name>QUERY</pub:name>
            <pub:values>
              <pub:item><![CDATA[ SELECT * FROM (SELECT * FROM ap_invoices) WHERE ROWNUM <= 2 ]]></pub:item>
            </pub:values>
          </pub:item>
        </pub:parameterNameValues>
      </pub:reportRequest>
    </pub:runReport>
  </soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>

request.description: A report to run standard SQL with PL/SQL initialisation.

body.raw:
<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope" xmlns:pub="http://xmlns.oracle.com/oxp/service/PublicReportService">
   <soapenv:Header/>
   <soapenv:Body>
      <pub:runReport>
         <pub:reportRequest>
         	<!-- Note that the report may change -->
          <pub:reportAbsolutePath>/Custom/More4apps/SQLReport/SQLReport.xdo</pub:reportAbsolutePath>
          <pub:sizeOfDataChunkDownload>-1</pub:sizeOfDataChunkDownload>
          <pub:attributeLocale>en-US</pub:attributeLocale>
          <pub:attributeTemplate>Default</pub:attributeTemplate>
          <pub:attributeFormat>xml</pub:attributeFormat>
	     <pub:byPassCache>true</pub:byPassCache>
	     <!-- Ensure the data is normalised with false -->
		<pub:flattenXML>false</pub:flattenXML>
          <!-- Parameter Binds -->
          <pub:parameterNameValues>
             <!-- Query Parameter -->
             <pub:item>
                <pub:name>QUERY</pub:name>
                <pub:values>
                  <pub:item><![CDATA[ SELECT APPROVED_DATE
								FROM PO_HEADERS_ALL
								WHERE
									(TO_CHAR(APPROVED_DATE, 'yyyymmddHH24MISS') IN ('20120712140634')
										OR TO_CHAR(APPROVED_DATE, 'yyyymmdd') IN ('20120712')) ]]></pub:item>
             	 </pub:values>
             </pub:item>
             <!-- End Query Parameter -->
            </pub:parameterNameValues>
        </pub:reportRequest>
      </pub:runReport>
   </soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>

request.description: A report to run standard SQL with date binds.

body.raw:
<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope" xmlns:pub="http://xmlns.oracle.com/oxp/service/PublicReportService">
   <soapenv:Header/>
   <soapenv:Body>
      <pub:runReport>
         <pub:reportRequest>
         	<!-- Note that the report may change -->
          <pub:reportAbsolutePath>/Custom/More4apps/More4appsSQL.xdo</pub:reportAbsolutePath>
          <pub:sizeOfDataChunkDownload>-1</pub:sizeOfDataChunkDownload>
          <pub:attributeLocale>en-US</pub:attributeLocale>
          <pub:attributeTemplate>Default</pub:attributeTemplate>
          <pub:attributeFormat>xml</pub:attributeFormat>
	     <pub:byPassCache>true</pub:byPassCache>
	     <!-- Ensure the data is normalised with false -->
		<pub:flattenXML>false</pub:flattenXML>
          <!-- Parameter Binds -->
          <pub:parameterNameValues>
             <!-- Query Parameter -->
             <pub:item>
                <pub:name>QUERY</pub:name>
                <pub:values>
                  <pub:item><![CDATA[ SELECT APPROVED_DATE
								FROM PO_HEADERS_ALL
								WHERE
									(TO_CHAR(APPROVED_DATE, 'yyyymmddHH24MISS') IN ('20120712140634')
										OR TO_CHAR(APPROVED_DATE, 'yyyymmdd') IN ('20120712')) ]]></pub:item>
             	 </pub:values>
             </pub:item>
             <!-- End Query Parameter -->
            </pub:parameterNameValues>
        </pub:reportRequest>
      </pub:runReport>
   </soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>

request.description: A report to run standard SQL with date binds.

A report to run standard SQL. This uses the REF CURSOR ability to run SQL statements. SQL is passed through as a parameter and run.

## Parameters
# QUERY
A Base64 string SQL statements wrapped in <![CDATA[ ]]>. Inline parameters are not supported.

A report to run standard SQL. This uses the REF CURSOR ability to run SQL statements. SQL is passed through as a parameter and run.

## Parameters
# QUERY
A Base64 string SQL statements wrapped in <![CDATA[ ]]>. Inline parameters are not supported.

A report to run standard SQL. This uses the REF CURSOR ability to run SQL statements. SQL is passed through as a parameter and run.

## Parameters
# QUERY
A Base64 string SQL statements wrapped in <![CDATA[ ]]>. Inline parameters are not supported.

A report to run standard SQL. This uses the REF CURSOR ability to run SQL statements. SQL is passed through as a parameter and run.

## Parameters
# QUERY
A Base64 string SQL statements wrapped in <![CDATA[ ]]>. Inline parameters are not supported.

body.raw:
<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:pub="http://xmlns.oracle.com/oxp/service/PublicReportService" xmlns:soapenv="http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope">
  <soapenv:Body>
    <pub:runReport>
      <pub:reportRequest>
        <!-- Set up a report with SELECT  invoice_id, invoice_date FROM ap_invoices_all WHERE invoice_date IN (:DATE1)  -->
        <pub:reportAbsolutePath>/Custom/Test/Date_Test_Report.xdo</pub:reportAbsolutePath>
        <pub:sizeOfDataChunkDownload>-1</pub:sizeOfDataChunkDownload>
        <pub:attributeLocale>en-US</pub:attributeLocale>
        <pub:attributeTemplate>Default</pub:attributeTemplate>
        <pub:attributeFormat>xml</pub:attributeFormat>
        <pub:byPassCache>true</pub:byPassCache>
        <pub:flattenXML>false</pub:flattenXML>
        <pub:parameterNameValues>
          <pub:item>
            <pub:name>DATE1</pub:name>
            <pub:values>
              <pub:item>01-01-2012</pub:item> <!-- 01-01-2012 -->
              <pub:item>01-04-2012</pub:item> <!-- 04-01-2012 -->
            </pub:values>
          </pub:item>
        </pub:parameterNameValues>
      </pub:reportRequest>
    </pub:runReport>
  </soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>

request.description:
# Date support within BI Publisher

## Setting up the report.
Create a SQL statement of:  
`SELECT invoice_date FROM AP_INVOICES_ALL WHERE invoice_date IN (:DATE1)`

Next set up the DATE1parameter with a Date type and format of:  
`MM-dd-yyyy`

body.raw:
<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:pub="http://xmlns.oracle.com/oxp/service/PublicReportService" xmlns:soapenv="http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope">
  <soapenv:Body>
    <pub:runReport>
      <pub:reportRequest>
        <!-- Set up a report with SELECT invoice_id, invoice_date FROM ap_invoices_all WHERE invoice_date IN (:DATE1)  -->
        <pub:reportAbsolutePath>/Custom/Test/Date_Test_Report.xdo</pub:reportAbsolutePath>
        <pub:sizeOfDataChunkDownload>-1</pub:sizeOfDataChunkDownload>
        <pub:attributeLocale>en-US</pub:attributeLocale>
        <pub:attributeTemplate>Default</pub:attributeTemplate>
        <pub:attributeFormat>xml</pub:attributeFormat>
        <pub:byPassCache>true</pub:byPassCache>
        <pub:flattenXML>false</pub:flattenXML>
        <pub:parameterNameValues>
          <pub:item>
            <pub:name>DATE_TIME</pub:name>
            <pub:values>
              <pub:item>12-04-201306:54:34</pub:item> <!-- 2013-12-04T06:54:34.000+00:00 -->
              <pub:item>08-12-201420:41:18</pub:item> <!-- 2014-08-12T20:41:18.000+00:00 -->
            </pub:values>
          </pub:item>
        </pub:parameterNameValues>
      </pub:reportRequest>
    </pub:runReport>
  </soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>

request.description:
# Date support within BI Publisher

## Setting up the report.
Create a SQL statement of:  
`SELECT creation_date FROM AP_INVOICES_ALL WHERE creation_date IN (:DATE_TIME)`

Next set up the DATE_TIME parameter with a Date type and format of:  
`MM-dd-yyyyHH:mm:ss`

body.raw:
<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:pub="http://xmlns.oracle.com/oxp/service/PublicReportService" xmlns:soapenv="http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope">
  <soapenv:Body>
    <pub:runReport>
      <pub:reportRequest>
        <!-- Set up a report with SELECT invoice_id, invoice_date FROM ap_invoices_all WHERE invoice_date IN (:DATE1)  -->
        <pub:reportAbsolutePath>/Custom/Test/Date_Test_Report.xdo</pub:reportAbsolutePath>
        <pub:sizeOfDataChunkDownload>-1</pub:sizeOfDataChunkDownload>
        <pub:attributeLocale>en-US</pub:attributeLocale>
        <pub:attributeTemplate>Default</pub:attributeTemplate>
        <pub:attributeFormat>xml</pub:attributeFormat>
        <pub:byPassCache>true</pub:byPassCache>
        <pub:flattenXML>false</pub:flattenXML>
        <pub:parameterNameValues>
          <pub:item>
            <pub:name>DATE_TIME</pub:name>
            <pub:values>
              <pub:item>12-04-201306:54:34</pub:item> <!-- 2013-12-04T06:54:34.000+00:00 -->
              <pub:item>08-12-201420:41:18</pub:item> <!-- 2014-08-12T20:41:18.000+00:00 -->
            </pub:values>
          </pub:item>
        </pub:parameterNameValues>
      </pub:reportRequest>
    </pub:runReport>
  </soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>

request.description:
# Date support within BI Publisher

## Setting up the report.
Create a SQL statement of:  
`SELECT creation_date FROM AP_INVOICES_ALL WHERE creation_date IN (:DATE_TIME)`

Next set up the DATE_TIME parameter with a Date type and format of:  
`MM-dd-yyyyHH:mm:ss`
